byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.

abstract: Case against Uber is slated to begin soon in European Court of Justice, European Union's highest court; suit, brought by Spanish group Asociacion Profesional Elite Taxi in 2014, accuses ride-booking service of unfair competition, complaint echoed by numerous taxi companies across Europe; ruling will decide how multi-billion tech firm's operations will be regulated within 28-nation bloc.

headline.print_headline: Transportation Service or Digital Platform? Classifying Uber in Europe
headline.main: In Europe, Is Uber a Transportation Service or a Digital Platform?

snippet: The European Court of Justice will hear arguments that will most likely determine how the ride-sharing service can operate across the European Union....
lead_paragraph: The European Court of Justice will hear arguments that will most likely determine how the ride-sharing service can operate across the European Union.
